questions.question_text:
ABC Company's centre of excellence (COE) has asked the project manager for the Health and Safety Training Project to trial a new standard course development model using an agile approach. The model recommends several shorter management stages, running in parallel, to enable more feedback and faster delivery to the market with reduced risk.
Is this an appropriate recommendation, and why?

choices.B: Yes, because delivery steps and management stages can occur at different times
choices.D: No, because delivery steps and management stages need to be aligned
choices.A: Yes, because shorter stages bring greater project board control to reduce risk
choices.C: No, because management stages should be sequential to allow commitment of resources

discussion.content: I feel C is correct, management stages cannot run parallel
managment stages dont run parallel, answer should be C

questions.question_text:
The 'e-learning course' is being delivered by an external consultancy. The consultancy completed work on the 'accredited e-learning course' during stage 3.
However, the 'delivered pilot courses' includes piloting of the e-learning course. As a result, the external consultancy is required to do further work as part of the
'finalized materials'.
When should the external consultancy close their project, and why?

discussion.content: The external consultancy should close their project when the ‘finalized materials’ have been approved. This is because the external consultancy’s business case is separate from ABC Company’s business case, and they should complete their contractual activities before closing. So, the correct answer would be: D

choices.A: When ABC Company closes the Health and Safety Training Project, because ABC Company's project manager should recommend project closure
choices.D: When the 'finalized materials' have been approved, because the external consultancy should complete its contractual activities before closing
choices.C: When the 'finalized materials' have been approved, because the external consultancy's business case is separate from ABC Company's business case
choices.B: When ABC Company closes the Health and Safety Training Project, because project closure should be planned by ABC Company's project manager

CHANGE -
A request for change has been raised to increase the number of advertisements published as part of the 'marketed courses' work package.
Here are three actions that will be carried out when managing this change.
In which management product (A-F) should they be recorded?
Choose only ONE management product for each action. Each product can be used once, more than once, or not at all.
Select and Place:
//IMG//

The 'e-learning course' is being delivered by an external consultancy. The team manager has advised the project manager that their plan is confidential and will be displayed on their team board as a list of requirements. The project manager has requested that the team manager share a milestone plan with the project management team instead for them to view.
Is this an appropriate action, and why?

discussion.content: Yes, because the project manager needs enough information to be able to monitor the plan

comments.content: Option C: No, because the supplier’s plans are typically confidential as they include details of other clients’ projects: This option is not valid because the supplier’s plans for ABC Company’s project should not include details of other clients’ projects. The supplier should respect the confidentiality and privacy of each client and only share relevant information with them. Moreover, a milestone plan does not need to include sensitive or confidential information, but only high-level information about the products, activities and milestones of a work package.

choices.A: Yes, because the project manager needs enough information to be able to monitor the plan
choices.D: No, because team plans can be in any format to meet the team's needs, including being presented as a list on team boards
choices.B: Yes, because the contract should specify rights of inspection on the e-learning course being delivered
choices.C: No, because the supplier's plans are typically confidential as they include details of other clients' projects

choices.B: Yes, because the recent government legislation means there is a market opportunity to exploit
choices.D: No, because compulsory projects that are driven by legislation must show that the chosen option is value for money
choices.C: No, because every project needs some form of documented and approved business justification
choices.A: Yes, because the project is following the company's standard course development model

questions.question_text:
PRINCIPLES -
The Health and Safety Training project is following ABC Company's standard course development model. The executive wants start the project as quickly as possible to exploit the market opportunities offered by the new legislation. Therefore, the executive has advised the project manager that a project brief is not required, and that the project can proceed to the initiation stage.
Is this an appropriate action for the 'continued business justification' principle, and why?

discussion.content:
C
According to the 'continued business justification' principle in PRINCE2, every project needs some form of documented and approved business justification
1
3
. Therefore, it is not appropriate for the executive to advise the project manager that a project brief is not required, and that the project can proceed to the initiation stage
